item.title: Graphing Gaussian Curves
item.description: I’ve been working my way through Prof. Sebastian Thrun’s second AI course, CS 373 Programming a Robotic Car that he is offering through the new company, Udacity. In week two he covers Kalman filters as a method of estimating location given uncertainty in sensor data and uncertainty in movement. In an effort to get a better understanding of how the variables affect the shape of the Gaussian distribution that represents the probable state of the variables being modelled, I fired up Octave.
